definition: to repay/to compensate for/to recompense/to fulfill (hopes etc)
to bestow (a reward)/to give (to an inferior)/to hand down/a reward (bestowed by a superior)/to appreciate (beauty)
to repay a debt in full/to redeem/to clear
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
to compensate/to make good (a financial loss)
to repay/to pay off a debt

sentences.english: For example, I've already said Mark believes that Jesus' death was a ransom.
sentences.chinese: 比如說，我講過馬可認爲耶穌的死是一種償贖。

sentences.english: They ced for more time to repay the loper.
sentences.chinese: 他們央求有更多的時間來了償存款。

sentences.english: So the horse partial said special for compensation for red fruits.
sentences.chinese: 於是馬偏言了特殊爲紅果補補償的事。

sentences.english: The first is the borrower's ability to repay the loan and the second is the market value of the property.
sentences.chinese: 首先是借債人了償貸款的能力，其次是財富的市值。

definition: to compensate for loss/to indemnify/to suffer a financial loss
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)
to hand in/to hand over/to seize
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
